results.title: Saboteur [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Frank Lloyd Productions and Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: Barry Kane, a Los Angeles aircraft factory worker witnesses his plant’s firebombing at the hands of a Nazi agent. During the blast his best friend is killed, and to heighten the tragedy Kane is wrongly accused of sabotage when it is discovered that the extinguisher Kane handed him was filled with an accelerant. In a desperate effort to clear his name, Kane begins a relentless cross country chase that traverses Boulder Dam, New York’s Radio City Music Hall, and culminates at the Statue of Liberty. This was Hitchcock’s first film to feature an all American cast. Stars Priscilla Lane, Robert Cummings, Otto Kruger, Alan Baxter, Clem Bevans, Norman Lloyd and Alma Kruger. Original screenplay by Peter Viertel, Joan Harrison and Dorothy Parker. Cinematography by Joseph Valentine.

results.title: S.S. British Sovereign
results.brief_description: Story of a British tanker from the drawing board through the shipyards to the high seas. Ship-building sequences at the Barrow-in-furnace yards in the north of England show extensive use of prefabricated methods and the film includes the launching, fitting-out and trial scenes.

results.title: S.P.L.A.S.H.
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Michael Mills and Judy LeGros
results.brief_description: This fast-paced and entertaining animated film is about water and the demands placed on our waterways by agriculture, industry, and urban life. An army of droplets, led by The Chief, shows what happens to water from the time it falls as rain until it reaches its destination.

results.title: S.O.S. iceberg
results.brief_description: The story of Dr Karl Laurence, an explorer who in the interest of Arctic research, set off to carry on the scientific investigation with the North Pole. A short film which has some great special effects with the iceberg.

results.title: S.O.S
results.brief_description: A study of the Cornish fishermen who man the lifeboats off the Cornish coast, ready at all times and in all weathers to go to the rescue of ships in distress.

results.title: Rythmetic
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Norman McLaren and Evelyn Lambart
results.brief_description: An animated film by Norman McLaren and Evelyn Lambart which endows arithmetic with lively humour. The screen becomes a numerical free-for-all as digits meet in playful encounter, add and subtract, jostle, attack, elude one another. (Ten awards: including Edinburgh, British Film Academy)

results.title: Ryokan: a Japanese-style hotel
results.creator_credit: Japan. National Tourist Organisation and Shu Taguchi Productions
results.brief_description: Ryokan is a Japanese style hotel. This film shows its traditional homelike atmosphere, its excellent cuisine and its up-to-date conveniences.

results.title: Ruth Stout's garden
results.brief_description: A revealing portrait of a charming individualist illustrating that age need not be a barrier to continued productivity and creativity. Ruth Stout, now in her tenth decade, remains active writing books, contributing regularly to periodicals, lecturing and perfecting her ‘no dig/no work’ method of gardening.

results.title: Rusty: the great rescue
results.creator_credit: Saban Entertainment, Craig Golin and Shuki Levy
results.brief_description: Rusty is a lovable, trusty beagle that lives at an animal shelter full of a great variety of animals. The human couple who run the shelter are grandparents to two recently orphaned kids. All seems fine until two crooks steal some puppies in order to take the trust fund from the kids. Rusty and his animal friends set out on an adventurous rescue to put things straight. Talking animals and colourful country setting make this a film for the family to enjoy. Directed by Shuki Levy. Cast includes Hal Holbrook, Rue McClanahan, Laraine Newman. Voices provided by Suzanne Somers, Rodney Dangerfield and Bobcat Goldthwait.

results.title: Rusting world = Declin
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Margaret Pettigrew and Laurent Coderre
results.brief_description: The scene is a desolate landscape which reveals no signs of life. Out of the stillness emerge two opposing factions, both wanting possession of a shiny object. This allegorical film suggests a decaying world created by greed, but the ultimate interpretation rests with the viewer.
